Waiting is not easy-post if you need someone to chat with- Use only internet sites that are reputable like imaginis.com and this one. if you do search. Take care, Karen
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy results Jude_Aussie Barbie7

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2008 07:38PM KarenC wrote: Jackie, 16 years ago the regular internal medicine dr. found a nodule on my thyroid and I had a thyroid uptake and scan, biopsy, etc. Benign nodule that has that has been watched over the years and I have had 5 biopsies total. The general surgeon watches me now and will release me next month to be checked by internal medicine dr for the rest of my life where the nodule is concerned. I have  never had a pet scan but biopsies are the only true way to get results as far as I know. Good luck and keep us updated. Karen

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2007 05:45PM KarenC wrote: I also had a stereotactic biopsy and was told no shower for 2 days, let the steri strips come off Saturday two days after biopsy and also to keep alternating ice on and off twenty minutes at a time for 3-4 hours immediately afterwards. And yes, there was a woman technician in the room the whole time- totally unheard of these days to just let the doctor be in there with you alone. I would definitely report him for being unprofessional. Good luck. Karen
Posts.Title: Scared and confused alayna15 KarenC

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2007 04:15PM KarenC wrote: I have had the old-fashioned machine for 8 years now and had 3 diagnostic mammograms-they are uncomfortable, not painful to me. On occassion I hae taken Tylenol before it and have always had them at least two weeks after my period so they are less painful/uncomfortable. The opinions are across the world as some techs are not as nice as others, density is different with age, cysts and other conditions may make it more painful-there are so many factors to consider. For my follow-up in Feb. 2008 I am considering having digital as they will be getting a new machine at a hospital in town-the first! Good luck. Karen
Posts.Title: OK, so how bad do mammograms really hurt? newgirl77 awb

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2007 04:21PM KarenC wrote: Koshka, I think you are doing the right thing-try not to second guess yourself your first instinct is usually your best one.  I did not take any tranquilizer before my biopsy but mine didn't last even close to an hour-actual time laying on table for me was at least 30 minutes maybe a little longer because I was nervous,I'm not certain about the time except for approximate guessing..... If it makes you feel better then do what Sheila recommends-the choice is up to you so that you are comfortable. Our thoughts are with you. Karen

Posts.Title: what is the next step? juliamiller Beesie

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2007 02:45PM KarenC wrote: Julia, It depends on what type of stereotactic biopsy you are having- core or vacum assisted. I had the mammotome vacum assisted and the needle only goes in once. With the core, I've read it goes in several times. Local anesthesia I had, I hardly felt anything. I felt the sting of the needle and some light tugging, pulling sensation and that's all. I had slight bruising for a few days and my scar is tiny compared to a surgical biopsy I had 8 years ago which the scar is at least 2 inches long! http://www.radiologyinfo.org/en/info.cfm?PG=breastbixr Try this website for more information and another  http://www.imaginis.com/index.html it has a lot ofinformation as well. We will all be thinking of you.  Good thoughts only. Karen
Posts.Title: what is the next step? juliamiller Beesie

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2007 08:17AM KarenC wrote: Koshka, Take care and I won't tell you to relax because that is impossible-I had to wait 4 days for my results and it was like forever. I cannot imagine 10 days! Please keep posting to chat with us and we will try and help until you know the results.

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2007 11:42PM KarenC wrote: Shannon, I would ask about a biopsy to give you peace of mind in this case. try www.imaginis.comfor more information on reading mammogram reports, it really is great for describing things and has links to other sites. Also, describes different types of biopsies. I just had a stereotactic vacum needle assisted biopsy for microcalcifications that ended up being benign. www.breatbiopsy.com is good for information describing this procedure. Please take care and let us know how everything turns out. Karen
